title: Understanding Qualitative Analysis
text: Qualitative analysis is used to identify the presence or absence of a substance in a sample. It does not measure the amount, but rather confirms if the substance is there or not.

title: Why Not Quantitative?
text: Quantitative analysis measures the amount of a substance in a sample. Since the goal is to confirm the absence of peanuts, measuring the amount is not necessary.

title: Characterization vs. Qualitative Analysis
text: Characterization involves determining the structure or properties of a substance, which is not needed here. We only need to confirm if peanuts are present or not.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: Based on the need to confirm the absence of peanuts, which type of analysis is appropriate?
